questions.question: In Scene 1, Polonius instructs Reynaldo to

choices.answer: determine Laertes's behavior indirectly.
supervise Laertes to keep him out of trouble.
spread damaging rumors about Laertes.
help Laertes make friends and learn the language.

questions.question: Hamlet visits Ophelia “with his doublet all unbraced, / No hat upon his head” to

choices.answer: ask her how she feels about him.
declare his love for her.
convince her of his madness.
tell her about the ghost of his father.

questions.question: Which quotation expresses the reason that Claudius has sent for Rosencrantz and Guildenstern?

choices.answer: “so by your companies / To draw him on to pleasures”
“glean, / Whether aught to us unknown afflicts him”
“Good gentlemen, he hath much talked of you”
“expend your time with us awhile”

questions.question: Polonius believes that the “very cause of Hamlet's lunacy” is his

choices.answer: father's death.
mother's overhasty marriage.
rejection by Ophelia.
obsession with revenge.

questions.question: To mock Polonius in his conversation with him in Scene 2, Hamlet uses

choices.answer: prose.
classical allusions.
puns.
hyperbole.

questions.question: “this goodly frame, the earth, seems to me a sterile promontory,” means that he

choices.answer: feels betrayed by their lies.
is depressed.
is touched that they have traveled so far to see him.
now has a clearer view of people and life.

questions.question: Why does Hamlet ask the player to recite the tale of Priam's slaughter?

choices.answer: It has a theme of revenge.
It is familiar to him.
He knows it is popular with audiences.
He is sending Claudius a warning.
frustration with his weak and indecisive nature.
anticipation of how he will feel if his plan works.
satisfaction with the plan he has made.
anxiety over the action he must take.

questions.question: A major reason for Hamlet's dilemma is that he

choices.answer: likes Claudius.
knows his mother would be sad to learn the truth.
is uncertain of the Ghost's authenticity.
does not want to become king himself.

questions.question: Hamlet's plan will work only if

choices.answer: the actors are skilled enough.
the plot is kept a secret until the very end of the play
the queen understands what is going on.
Claudius still has the capacity to feel guilt.
